Global Function is_fkey()

is_fkey() if the parameter is the scancode of a function key. If so, this function returns TRUE, else it returns FALSE.

int is_fkey ( unsigned int scancode )
Prototyped in: keys.h
Called by: do_funkey()funkey.c
  popup()popup.c
  pulldown()pulldown.c

Global Function key_pressed()

key_pressed() checks the status of the keyboard by means of bioskey(x) function. If a key was pressed it returns TRUE, else it returns (FALSE). Note that the keypress is not dequeued for the buffer.

int key_pressed ( void )
Prototyped in: keys.h
Calls: wn_log()wn_log.c
  bioskey()
Called by: waitkey()keys.c

Global Function shift_status()

shift_status returns the state of the shift state with bioskey(2)

unsigned char shift_status ( void )
Prototyped in: keys.h
Calls: bioskey()
Called by: editstr()editstr.c

Global Function waitkey()

waitkey() waits for a keypress. If a key is pressed, it will return the scancode in case of a special key, or the ASCII value (that is, the scancode & 0x00FF)

unsigned int waitkey ( void )
Prototyped in: keys.h
Calls: key_pressed()keys.c
  wn_log()wn_log.c
  bioskey()
Called by: editstr()editstr.c
  get_dir()dir.c
  popup()popup.c
  pulldown()pulldown.c
  show_topic()help.c
  wn_dialog()dialog.c
